first_para: Peter Heaton-Jones, (b. 2 August 1963), is a British politician and journalist who has held senior positions in the media and politics in both the UK and Australia. He is the Conservative Party's Prospective Parliamentary Candidate for North Devon. In 2010 he was elected as a Borough Councillor in Swindon, Wiltshire, and was Agent for the general election campaigns of the two new Conservative MPs in Swindon. In the media, he is best known for presenting news programmes on BBC national and local radio in the UK, and was the former head of marketing for ABC radio in Australia.
